paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: 49 ± 6 years old, 4 out of 5 were female

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Four out of five patients diagnosed with LQTS2 were female, these patients were 49 ± 6 years old at the time of their Holter and all used beta-blockers.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 gene encodes the hERG channel, which is crucial for cardiac repolarization.

variants.segregation_data: The presence of the variant is associated with LQTS2 phenotype.
variants.additional_notes: All patients with the variant were diagnosed with LQTS2.
key_quotes: Patients clinically diagnosed with LQTS type II carrying a loss-of function mutation of the KCNH2 gene encoding the protein that constitutes the hERG channel.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
